chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
k: lb
m: lb
l: lb

Goal:
l ⪯ m -> m ⪯ k -> l ⪯ k

Premises:
Inductive lb_mask : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l | in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil | in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m Arguments lb_mask (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_1 [l]%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_2 (_ _)%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
lb_mask_leb : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
lb_mask_inv_cons : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x :: l ⪯ y :: m -> x ⪦ y /\ l ⪯ m
lb_mask_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_mask_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_mask_inv_cons_cons : forall l m : lb, ⟙ :: l ⪯ ⟘ :: m -> False
lb_mask_inv_nil : forall l : lb, ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil -> l ⪯ nil
in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil
lb_mask_inv_left : forall (x : bool) (l : lb), x :: l ⪯ nil -> x = ⟘ /\ l ⪯ nil
lb_mask_inv_cons_nil : forall l : lb, ⟙ :: l ⪯ nil -> False
lb_mask_refl : forall l : lb, l ⪯ l
in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => m | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => n | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.add p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Ring_polynom.mkVmon = fun (i : BinNums.positive) (M : Ring_polynom.Mon) => match M with | Ring_polynom.mon0 => Ring_polynom.vmon i Ring_polynom.mon0 | Ring_polynom.zmon j m => Ring_polynom.vmon i (Ring_polynom.zmon_pred j m) | Ring_polynom.vmon i' m => Ring_polynom.vmon (BinPos.Pos.add i i') m end : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Mon Arguments Ring_polynom.mkVmon _%positive_scope
BinNatDef.N.eqb = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => match m with | BinNums.N0 => ⟙ | BinNums.Npos _ => ⟘ end | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => ⟘ | BinNums.Npos q => BinPos.Pos.eqb p q end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.eqb (_ _)%N_scope
Ring_polynom.mon_of_pol_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall l : list R, req (rmul (phi (fst m)) (Ring_polynom.Mphi rO rI rmul l (snd m))) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P)
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.mul p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
EnvRing.PNSubstL_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> req (EnvRing.Pphi radd rmul phi l P1) (EnvRing.Pphi radd rmul phi l (EnvRing.PNSubstL cO cI cadd cmul ceqb P1 LM1 m n))
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
Ring_polynom.mkZmon_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> forall (M : Ring_polynom.Mon) (j : BinNums.positive) (l : list R), req (Ring_polynom.Mphi rO rI rmul l (Ring_polynom.mkZmon j M)) (Ring_polynom.Mphi rO rI rmul l (Ring_polynom.zmon j M))
Field_theory.PCond_app : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (phi : C -> R) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : BinNums.N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R) (l : list R) (l1 l2 : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C)), Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l (l1 ++ l2) < -> Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l l1 /\ Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l l2
Ring_polynom.Ppow_N_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (P : Ring_polynom.Pol C) (n : BinNums.N), req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l (Ring_polynom.Ppow_N cO cI cadd cmul ceqb subst_l P n)) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l (Ring_theory.pow_N (Ring_polynom.P1 cI) (Ring_polynom.Pmul cO cI cadd cmul ceqb) P n))
filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> map f l = map g l
Field_theory.PCond_cons : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (phi : C -> R) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : BinNums.N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R) (l : list R) (a : Ring_polynom.PExpr C) (l1 : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C)), Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l (a :: l1) < -> ~ req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l a) rO /\ Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l l1
Ring_polynom.Padd_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (P' P : Ring_polynom.Pol C) (l : list R), req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l (Ring_polynom.Padd cO cadd ceqb P P')) (radd (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P'))
Ring_polynom.Psub_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (P' P : Ring_polynom.Pol C) (l : list R), req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l (Ring_polynom.Psub cO cadd csub copp ceqb P P')) (rsub (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P'))
Ring_polynom.Pmul_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (P P' : Ring_polynom.Pol C) (l : list R), req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l (Ring_polynom.Pmul cO cI cadd cmul ceqb P P')) (rmul (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P'))
Field_theory.Fnorm_crossproduct : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> (forall p q : R, req p q -> req (rinv p) (rinv q)) -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req ->...-> req (Field_theory.FEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv phi Cp_phi rpow l fe1) (Field_theory.FEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv phi Cp_phi rpow l fe2)
Ring_polynom.mkVmon_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (M : Ring_polynom.Mon) (i : BinNums.positive) (l : list R), req (Ring_polynom.Mphi rO rI rmul l (Ring_polynom.mkVmon i M)) (rmul (Ring_polynom.Mphi rO rI rmul l M) (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul (hd rO l) i))
